name.str_pl: copies of Zombie Survival Guide

description: While this seems like it would be very useful in this situation, the sheer amount of misinformation present makes it practically useless.
A full flight log for a military aircraft.  Nothing of interest stands out.
A short paper of the economic viability of constructing an agricultural outpost.
This binder details the scheduled maintenance for several plumbing systems throughout the facility.

name.str_pl: books of essays

description: A collection of essays by various authors from around the world, including works by Churchill, Mailer, Eco, and Voltaire.

name.str: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Cataclysm
name.str_pl: copies of The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Cataclysm

description: Inscribed on the cover in large, friendly letters, is the message "Don't Panic".
A super-hero comic.

name.str_pl: issues of Computer Gaming

description: Reviews of recently released computer games and previews of upcoming titles.
Current events concerning a bunch of people who're all (un)dead now.

name.str_pl: issues of The Analyst

description: This news magazine has been described as "a kind of Reader's Digest for America's corporate elite."  These concerns are, of course, behind us now.

name.str_pl: issues of Playboy

description: You can read it for the articles.  Or not.
A notepad with a number of frequencies scribbled on it.

name.str_pl: issues of Rural Digest-Examiner

description: A newsweekly covering regional events.  There is an article on the winter's snowstorms and several letters to the editor concerning the community response.
The stirring tale of a race against time, in search of a lost city located in the heart of the African continent.
A gripping tale of two friends struggling to survive on the streets of New York City.
After their diamond heist goes wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.
A story about three people in the fictional city of Los Santos: a gangster, an upper-class man, and a psychopath.  They eventually band together to pull off the biggest heist in the city's history

name.str_pl: copies of Murdered by the Grapevine

description: This cheap paperback tells the story of a mob boss done in by mere suspicion.  She never breaks a confidence, never rats out an accomplice, and never turns her back on a friend.  Nonetheless her grip on the reigns of the underworld is eroded by rumor and paranoia.

name.str_pl: copies of Midnight Cop

description: In this bare-knuckled potboiler, a ruthless police detective schemes to shut down local crime lords by pitting them against each other.  When long-simmering resentments finally flare the city learns why they call it "the dead of night."
A real book for real adults.
A hackneyed fictional narrative concealing low-grade literary smut.
A bizarre play about the philosophy of existential absurdity.  Or maybe it's about two guys waiting for their friend to show up.  It's confusing.
Basic sword & sorcery.
Maybe not the best reading material considering the situation.
A detective investigates an unusual murder in a secluded location.
A tale about a group of friends who wander the USA in the 1960s against a backdrop of jazz, poetry and drug use.

name.str_pl: copies of Gore Longitude

description: Award-winning author Cornac McCaffordy weaves a chilling tale of horror and strife, following the compellingly lucrative, seductively dangerous bounty hunting and scalping trade across the western frontier.
Drama and mild smut.

name.str_pl: copies of Love and Circuses

description: The passionate saga of two Boston politicians fiercely battling each other for the mayor's office, and for Lydia's hand in marriage.

name.str_pl: copies of Cloven Kisses

description: When the devil falls in love with a warlock, his proposal must be infernally wicked.  Will hooves, horns, and the scent of sulfur condemn love's flames to hellfire?

name.str_pl: copies of Conquer Me Sweetly

description: Sweet Providence Books is delighted to offer you this romantic tale of delicious dalliances and daring delights.

name.str_pl: copies of Dubliner's Debutante

description: His love songs were only for me, but I preferred the banjo over bagpipes.  How could I ever love a kilted yankee of foreign breeding?

name.str_pl: copies of Blood Diodes

description: He is an automaton, she is a reformed vampire, can love find a way?  In this edgy romance by acclaimed author Kea Dekker, heartbreak is just the beginning.

name.str_pl: copies of Envying Heaven

description: When her fiancee names a star for her Wanda begins to wonder if an astronomer's wife can ever compete with the allure of the cosmos.

name.str_pl: copies of Tall, Dark, and Gruesome

description: Fatima's obsession with the dead threatens to consume her when she falls in love with a restless ghost.  In this provocative romp celebrated author Kea Dekker gently lifts the thin veil separating cold bodies from warm.

name.str_pl: copies of Along Came a Rider

description: When Beth's career as a pro steeplechase jockey threatens to divide her from her lover, Beth has to act fast.  Will she ever find a man that can keep up with her racing heart?

name.str_pl: copies of Rogue's Virtue

description: Can Victoria reform the fugitive from justice who wooed her with false pretenses and true passion?

name.str: The Death of My Secret Life
name.str_pl: copies of The Death of My Secret Life

description: Makeda comes out to her family, but she's still got plenty of skeletons in her closet.  Best selling authoress Kea Dekker breaks all the rules in this macabre story of love and lies.
The classic tale of a wandering swordsman who comes to a small settlement and is hired to help the townsfolk defend themselves from a band of marauding outlaws.  This hardback is quite hefty.
A political satire of the pre-apocalypse world.  Looking back on it from this side of Armageddon makes it seem all the more ridiculous.

name.str_pl: copies of The House of God

description: Set in a lightly disguised Boston hospital of high repute, Samuel Shem's novel dives deep into the agony of absurdity.

name.str_pl: copies of Catch-22

description: There is a short informational forward in this paperback edition of Catch-22.  Apparently the original title for Joseph Heller's excruciatingly brilliant war satire was "Catch-11."

name.str_pl: copies of Master and Margarita

description: Featuring a cast that includes Satan, Pontius Pilate, Jesus Christ, vampires, a talking cat, and the literary elite of Moscow, this novel by Mikhail Bulgakov explores philosophical issues on the nature of good and evil.

name.str_pl: copies of A Handful of Dust

description: Laced with cynicism, Evelyn Waugh's "A Handful of Dust" satirizes a stratum of characters who have wealth, but lack any other credentials.

name.str_pl: copies of Cat's Cradle

description: A paperback edition of Kurt Vonnegut's fourth novel, in which the threat of nuclear destruction isn't much of an influence on human nature.
A tale of intrigue and espionage amongst Nazis, no, Commies, no, Iraqis!

name.str_pl: copies of Come Fly the Treacherous Skies

description: This tale of intrigue betrays the story of a debonair mechanic driven by a lust for revenge.  As she uncovers a sophisticated network of amateur pilots turned smugglers, the good guys and the bad guys begin to all look the same.

name.str: Lies, Damn Lies, and Rocket Science
name.str_pl: copies of Lies, Damn Lies, and Rocket Science

description: This spy novel tells the story of a jaded rocket scientist looking for redemption in all the wrong places.  As selling state secrets becomes her career, she learns there isn't much of difference between a double-agent and a triple-agent.
An exciting seventeenth century tale of how an enslaved Irish doctor and his comrades-in-chains escape and become heroic pirates of the Robin Hood variety.

name.str_pl: copies of The Black Freighter

description: Who watches the watchmen?  Pirate Jenny, that's who!  This swashbuckling adventure novel will make you feel swell.

name.str: Captain Gosnold and the Sea Rovers of Buzzards Bay
name.str_pl: copies of The Sea Rovers

description: This lengthy paperback novel describes the ocean exploits of Captain Gosnold.  The British consider him an outlaw, but in America he is a patriot.

name.str_pl: copies of The Buccaneer

description: The cover of this paperback pirate story shows a shirtless man and a near shirtless woman.  Clearly it is not a dress code.
A suspenseful tale of betrayal and revenge.
The story of two young lovers whose feuding families threaten to keep them apart.
A thrilling narrative of survival in a prisoner of war camp during the Second World War, filled with riveting subplots about rat farming and dysentery.
A story about a Bosnian citizen who goes through many hardships and near death during the breakup of Yugoslavia.
The classic tale of a gunfighting stranger who comes to a small settlement and is hired to help the townsfolk defend themselves from a band of marauding outlaws.

name.str_pl: copies of Atwixt a Brace of Cacti

description: A grizzled clodhopper interviews a mess of rangehands, flummoxing longhorns and tenderfoot alike in a flusteration of jawing.

name.str_pl: copies of Stinky Bart Puts on Starch

description: A local bandit, driven by sadistic impulses, begins offering unlicensed dentistry to brave frontiersmen with few options and fewer teeth.

name.str_pl: copies of Six Beans in the Wheel

description: The safety is off in this gun slinging tale of revenge and redemption by acclaimed author El Amor.

name.str_pl: copies of Irons at Calico Queen Annex

description: The establishment of a telegraph line into the recently named town of Calico Queen threatens to bring with it the long arm of the law.  A trio of enterprising gunfighters hatches a plan to keep Calico Queen wild by looting the supply wagons.

name.str_pl: copies of Riot on the Range

description: Best selling author El Amor paints a visceral study in red with his latest western saga: Riot on the Range.

name.str_pl: copies of Vaquero Sun

description: Western author El Amor relates the story of a dispossessed young man inspired by a heat stroke delusion to pursue justice against an evil land baron.

name.str_pl: copies of The Vendetta Riders

description: A wild young man, fast on the draw, who thinks he has nothing to lose, falls in with a group of gun runners.
This hefty volume contains the telephone numbers of individuals, businesses, and utilities.  Pretty useless during the apocalypse and all.
A leather album full of photos of somebody's family.  You don't know any of the people in them, but seeing these pictures still makes you think of happier times.

name.str_pl: books of plays

description: A collection of plays by various authors from around the world, including scripts by Wilde, Beckett, Checkov, and Shakespeare.

name.str_pl: books of poetry

description: A collection of poetry by various authors from around the world, including writings by Dickinson, Goethe, Thoreau, and Yeats.

name.str_pl: priests' diaries

description: A small book filled with journal entries in Latin.  You can read Latin, right?
If you knew what to look for, something might stand out…
A massive stack of medical records that contain every gory detail.
Old weather records are about as interesting as a rock.

name.str_pl: big books of short stories

description: This humongous volume contains a vast collection of short stories by different authors, spanning a wide variety of topics and genres.

name.str_pl: books of tall tales

description: An entertaining collection of early American folklore, featuring tales of larger than life individuals and their amazing adventures.

name.str_pl: copies of Visions in Solitude

description: A small book detailing 'visions' a prisoner had on death row.

name.str_pl: books of classic literature

description: A book of classic literature, timeless and enjoyable but a bit dense to read.

snippet_category.text: This is a copy of Dickens' "Bleak House".
This is a copy of "Great Expectations" by Charles Dickens.
This is a copy of William Shinderling's "Under the Beech Trees".
This is a collection of three Jane Austen novels: "Pride and Prejudice", "Sense and Sensibility", and "Emma".
This is a well-worn paperback copy of "Lord of the Flies".
This is a copy of "To Kill a Mockingbird" by Harper Lee.
This is a copy of F. Scott Fitzgerald's "The Great Gatsby."
This is a copy of Michael Abanaderly's lesser-known work, "He Walks".
This is a collection of several vintage science fiction stories by Ray Bradbury.
This is a copy of "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" by Mark Twain.
This is an illustrated copy of "Innocents Abroad" by Mark Twain.
This is a copy of Bram Stoker's "Dracula", with scholarly commentary in the margins.
This is a large print copy of Tolstoy's "War and Peace".  It might make a decent improvised weapon.
This is a paperback copy of the well-known classic "Dark Days Ahead", by K. G. Ranade.  There are scrawled margin notes all over it, apparently the workings of a confused and feverish mind.
This is a copy of "Jane Eyre".  The cover art is quite out of place, making it look more like a dime-store romance novel.
This is a perfectly preserved hardcover copy of "The Gunslinger" by Stephen King, autographed by the author.  It contains a certificate of authenticity pronouncing it to be a first edition.
This paperback copy of "Wuthering Heights" has a large coffee stain on the first page.
This is a hardbound copy of "Lady Chatterly's Lover", by D. H. Lawrence.  It has some very explicit illustrations.
This is a hardbound copy of "The Catcher in the Rye.".  It has some very nicely done illustrations.
This is a collection of classic renaissance era stories, headlined by "Don Quixote".
This is a paperback copy of "The Fellowship of the Ring" by Tolkien.
This is a paperback copy of "The Two Towers" by Tolkien.
This is a paperback copy of "The Return of the King" by Tolkien.
This is a hardbound collection of George Orwell's works, including "1984" and "Animal Farm" as well as many of his less infamous titles.
This is a paperback copy of "Little Women" by Louisa May Alcott.  It appears to have been read a great many times.
This is a paperback copy of "Of Mice and Men" by Steinbeck.
This is a hefty hardcover copy of "Run and Run Again" by Finn Calpay.  There is a lengthy forward about the controversy around the book's release.
This is a hardcover copy of "The Gates Have Opened" by Arianna Methusalah.  You feel like you've read this before, but can't remember where.  Something about the book fills you with unease.
This is a copy of "The Count of Monte Cristo" by Dumas.
This is a copy of "The Secret Garden" by Frances Burnett.
This is a copy of "Lieutenant Hornblower" by C.S. Forester.
This is a copy of "Master and Commander" by Patrick O'Brian.
This is a copy of "The Warden" by Anthony Trollope.
This is a copy of "The Far Side of the World" by Patrick O'Brian.
This is a copy of "HMS Surprise" by Patrick O'Brian.
This is a copy of "Barchester Towers" by Anthony Trollope.
This is a copy of "The Land Ironclads" by H.G. Wells.
This is a copy of "The Great Boer War" by Arthur Conan Doyle.
This is a copy of "The Crime of the Congo" by Arthur Conan Doyle.
This is a copy of "The Parasite" by Arthur Conan Doyle.
This is a copy of "By Stroke of Sword" by Andrew Balfour.
This is a copy of "The Secret Agent" by Joseph Conrad.
This is a copy of "Lord Jim" by Joseph Conrad.
This is a copy of "Vanity Fair" by William Makepeace Thackeray.
This is a copy of "The Luck of Barry Lyndon" by William Makepeace Thackeray.
This is a copy of "North and South" by Elizabeth Gaskell.
This is a copy of "The Mayor of Casterbridge" by Thomas Hardy.
This is a copy of "Wessex Tales" by Thomas Hardy.
This is a copy of "Far from the Madding Crowd" by Thomas Hardy.
This is a copy of "Captains Courageous" by Rudyard Kipling.
This is a copy of "The Canterbury Tales" by Geoffrey Chaucer.
This is a copy of "Harold, the Last of the Saxons" by Edward Bulwer-Lytton.
This is a copy of "Mr Midshipman Easy" by Frederick Marryat.
This is a copy of "Peter Simple" by Frederick Marryat.

description: A unique, valuable book that has been kept as a collector's item.

snippet_category.text: This is a high-quality leather bound copy of Charles Dickens' "A Tale of Two Cities".
This is a very old but well-preserved copy of Charles Dickens' "Oliver Twist".
This high-quality copy of Jane Austen's "Pride and Prejudice" is dog-eared and looks to have been read many times.
This is a hefty, hardcover print of William Shinderling's "Vanity before Justice" with beautiful illustrations.
This copy of Jane Austen's "Sense and Sensibility" has a certificate of authenticity declaring it to be an early edition.  It would have been worth an enormous amount of money, not long ago.
This is an excellent quality copy of "To Kill a Mockingbird" by Harper Lee.
This is a high-quality leather bound copy of F. Scott Fitzgerald's "The Great Gatsby."
This is a hefty, hardcover print of Michael Abanaderly's opus, "Lady Wanderlust".  It is over a hundred years old, but doesn't look it.
This copy of Ray Bradbury's "Fahrenheit 451" has a certificate of authenticity declaring it to be an early edition.  It would have been worth an enormous amount of money, not long ago.
This high-quality copy of "Pride and Prejudice and Zombies" has been autographed by the author.

This is a high-quality leather bound copy of "The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn" by Mark Twain.  It contains some margin notes which themselves are quite old, and look to have been done by a scholar of some sort.
This is a very nice print of Bram Stoker's "Dracula".  It has a certificate of authenticity with it that declares it a genuine early edition.
This copy of Douglas Adams' "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy" has a certificate of authenticity declaring it to be a first edition, and is autographed by the author himself.
This is a high-quality leather bound copy of the well-known classic "Dark Days Ahead", by K. G. Ranade.
This is a well-kept leather bound copy of "Oryx and Crake" by Margaret Atwood.  Inscribed in the inner cover is a faded note wishing the owner a happy birthday.
This is a perfectly preserved hardcover copy of "The Gunslinger" by Stephen King, autographed by the author.  It contains a certificate of authenticity pronouncing it to be a first edition.
This bright orange hardcover copy of "1984" by George Orwell has been carefully preserved, and appears to be a first or second edition judging from the publisher's information.
This is a very nice copy of "Lady Chatterly's Lover", probably quite expensive in the days before the apocalypse.
This is a high quality early edition hardcover copy of "The Handmaid's Tale" by Margaret Atwood, signed by the author.

This ancient and worn book looks to be an 18th or early 19th century handwritten copy of "Don Quixote".  In the days of book traders it would have been worth an absolute fortune.  Now it's either a priceless piece of history, some light reading before bed, or excellent kindling.
This is a first edition copy of Terry Pratchett's "The Colour of Magic".  In the inner cover is a handwritten note that reads "To Chris, thanks for believing I could do it.  Best regards, Terry."

name.str_pl: copies of The Economicon

description: These are the prescriptures Pile 18 Disk sg30 File 14.  "Look, small brain of pink earth inside my null-grasping, and she/he receives Logos; and it lay with the Wor."

name.str_pl: copies of The Bobliographon

description: The back cover of this cheaply published paperback reads: "These newly-released SubGenius revelations will SHOCK those who think they know Bob!  Unpredictables are not alone and possess amazing hidden powers of their own!  In a world without slack, a yeti lust revival saunters about.  WARNING: Do not fail to pay full price for this book; JHVH-1's wrath knows some bounds."

name.str_pl: copies of Solomon in Yellow

description: This paperback is titled "Glimpses of Solomon in Yellow; The Initiation Rites of the Starry Wisdom Covenant, by Dr. Enoch Craven."  It describes not just the investiture of new adherents, but the history and beliefs of the Church of Starry Wisdom.  Someone has defaced the sparse citations section by scrawling "PUPPETS OF ROME!" over its few pages.  The book does not provide any biography for Dr. Craven, let alone academic credentials.

A hefty book with a thick leather cover and metal clasps.  Both covers are completely empty, though on the first page there is an author's name written in English: "Abdul Alhazred"; below it the book title is written in Arabian: "العزيف", and below it in Greek: "Νεκρονομικόν".  The book looks very old and sinister.

A Siddur, or prayerbook, contains the set order of prayers for Jewish religious services.  This one is comprehensive, divided into morning, afternoon, and evening prayers for both weekdays and Shabbat, along with separate sections for minor and major holidays.
This is a book of Judaica.  You're a real mensch if you managed to find this one.

name.str_pl: copies of Hell in Jewish Literature

variants.description: A analysis of rabbinic discussions of Gehinnom, the Jewish afterlife for the cleansing of sins, including how big it is, how hot it is, who goes there, how long they stay there, whether there is any relief from their punishments in the meantime, and exactly what shape Gehinnom is.

name.str: Mimekor Yisrael, Book One: The National Tales
name.str_pl: copies of Mimekor Yisrael, Book One: The National Tales

variants.description: A collection of Jewish folktales, from Ashmedai king of demons to golem-making rabbis, from the Torah scholar who showed Aristotle the futility of philosophy to how Satan refused to bow to Adam because Adam was created from the dust of the earth, from martyrs murdered by Christian persecutors to General Joab single-handedly killing two thousand Amalekites so that when the blood ran out like a river through the city gates his troops knew to stop besieging the city and assault it, and dozens more besides.

name.str: On the Doorposts of Your House
name.str_pl: copies of On the Doorposts of Your House

variants.description: A list of prayers, meditations, and rituals for use at home, from lighting the Shabbat candles to welcoming a new child into the household.

name.str: The Observant Life: The Wisdom of Contemporary Judaism for Contemporary Jews
name.str_pl: copies of The Observant Life: The Wisdom of Contemporary Judaism for Contemporary Jews

variants.description: A long discussion of the ways in which Judaism's ancient rituals, traditions, and ethical practices are still relevant and meaningful in the modern world.  Unfortunately, there's no discussion of post-apocalyptic Judaism.

name.str_pl: copies of Siddur Tisha b'Av

variants.description: A prayerbook for Tisha b'Av, the most solemn day in the Jewish year.  This one also contains the full text of the book of Lamentations and selected commentaries.

name.str: Coming to Terms with America: Essays on Jewish History, Religion, and Culture
name.str_pl: copies of Coming to Terms with America: Essays on Jewish History, Religion, and Culture

variants.description: A series of fifteen essays by Jonathan Sarna on Jews' attempt to be both distinctively Jewish but also definitely American, covering the American Revolution through to contemporary times.

name.str_pl: copies of In This Hour

variants.description: An English translation of works written by Rabbi Abraham Joshua Heschel during the Nazi rule of Germany and Rabbi Heschel's exile in England, concerning historic and current persecution and his vision for Jewish education.

name.str: Jewish Literacy: The Most Important Things to Know About the Jewish Religion, Its People and Its History
name.str_pl: copies of Jewish Literacy: The Most Important Things to Know About the Jewish Religion, Its People and Its History

variants.description: Rabbi Joseph Telushkin's encyclopedic tome of Jewish life, running to hundreds of chapters and answering questions about the Hebrew bible, the Talmud, the holidays and rituals, the Holocaust, Israel and the diaspora, and everything in between.

name.str: Biblical Literacy: The Most Important People, Events and Ideas of the Hebrew Bible
name.str_pl: copies of Biblical Literacy: The Most Important People, Events and Ideas of the Hebrew Bible

variants.description: Rabbi Joseph Telushkin's exploration and analysis of the Hebrew Bible, containing a myriad of commentary and analysis, including on famous stories like the Binding of Isaac or the Exodus, a discussion of the weekly Torah readings that form part of the Jewish liturgical calendar, and a list of all 613 mitzvot.

name.str: This Is Real and You Are Completely Unprepared
name.str_pl: copies of This Is Real and You Are Completely Unprepared

variants.description: An in-depth discussion of the High Holy Days, starting with the Three Weeks and Nine Days before Tisha b'Av and continuing all the way through Sukkot, as a single period of rising and falling emotion, wherein each individual prepares themselves to stand before God.  A very well-known book that some people read every year and others mean to get around to finally reading this year.

name.str: OU Manual for Checking Fruits and Vegetables
name.str_pl: copies of the OU Manual for Checking Fruits and Vegetables

variants.description: A comprehensive guide to checking produce for insect infestation and how to prepare produce according to Jewish dietary law.

name.str_pl: copies of Shalom Rav, Volume 1

variants.description: Rabbi Shalom Rosner's commentary on the weekly Torah portion, covering the books of Genesis and Exodus.

name.str_pl: copies of Shalom Rav, Volume 2

variants.description: Rabbi Shalom Rosner's commentary on the weekly Torah portion, covering the books of Leviticus, Numbers, and Deuteronomy.

name.str: The Origins of Judaism: An Archaeological-Historical Reappraisal
name.str_pl: copies of The Origins of Judaism: An Archaeological-Historical Reappraisal

variants.description: An examination of the archeological evidence behind the beginning of many Jewish traditions, including eschewing pork, adopting tefillin and placing mezuzot on doorposts, and circumcision.

name.str_pl: copies of the Guide for the Perplexed

variants.description: An English translation of the great sage Rabbi Moses ben Maimon's work finding common points between natural philosophy and Talmudic scholarship.  Contains the famous Thirteen Principles of Faith, accepted by many Jews as a summary of the fundamental beliefs of Judaism.

name.str: Jewish Publication Society Torah Commentary: Genesis
name.str_pl: copies of the Jewish Publication Society Torah Commentary: Genesis

variants.description: A series of Torah commentaries written by scholars and academics, containing the traditional Hebrew text, a translation, and various notes.  This volume is for the book of Genesis.

name.str: Jewish Publication Society Torah Commentary: Exodus
name.str_pl: copies of the Jewish Publication Society Torah Commentary: Exodus

variants.description: A series of Torah commentaries written by scholars and academics, containing the traditional Hebrew text, a translation, and various notes.  This volume is for the book of Exodus.

name.str: Jewish Publication Society Torah Commentary: Leviticus
name.str_pl: copies of the Jewish Publication Society Torah Commentary: Leviticus

variants.description: A series of Torah commentaries written by scholars and academics, containing the traditional Hebrew text, a translation, and various notes.  This volume is for the book of Leviticus.

name.str: Jewish Publication Society Torah Commentary: Numbers
name.str_pl: copies of the Jewish Publication Society Torah Commentary: Numbers

variants.description: A series of Torah commentaries written by scholars and academics, containing the traditional Hebrew text, a translation, and various notes.  This volume is for the book of Numbers.

name.str: Jewish Publication Society Torah Commentary: Deuteronomy
name.str_pl: copies of the Jewish Publication Society Torah Commentary: Deuteronomy

variants.description: A series of Torah commentaries written by scholars and academics, containing the traditional Hebrew text, a translation, and various notes.  This volume is for the book of Deuteronomy.

name.str_pl: copies of the Shulchan Arukh

variants.description: Compiled by Rabbi Yosef Karo in the 16th century, the Shuchan Arukh is the most widely-consulted and authoritative compilation of Jewish law lasting into the present day.  If you need to convene a post-Cataclysmic Beit Din, keep this with you and you'll be set.

description: This is a book of Judaica.  You're a real mensch if you managed to find this one.

name.str: A Short History of the Jewish People: From Legendary Times to to Modern Statehood
name.str_pl: copies of A Short History of the Jewish People: From Legendary Times to to Modern Statehood

variants.description: A survey-level study of Jewish history, from Biblical times through to the 1990s.  At only 250 pages long, it is by necessity very brief on any individual topic.

name.str_pl: copies of I and Thou

variants.description: An English translation of Martin Buber's philosophical work on the relationships of human beings to each other and to God.

name.str_pl: copies of Living a Jewish Life

variants.description: Anita Diamant's survey-level discussion of the daily practices and rituals of Jewish life.  Originally mostly superseded by the free availability of information on the internet, it's much more useful now for everyone who feels bad that they didn't attend their synagogue often enough before it was overrun.

name.str_pl: copies of What Is a Jew

variants.description: Rabbi Morris Kertzer's introductory text about Judaism and Jewish beliefs, written as a series of questions and then answers, primarily from a Reform viewpoint but with explicit mention of where Conservative or Orthodox Jews would disagree.

name.str: The Way of Humanity: According to Chasidic Teachings
name.str_pl: copies of The Way of Humanity: According to Chasidic Teachings

variants.description: An English translation of lectures given by Martin Buber on six traditional Chasidic stories from the 18th and 19th centuries.

name.str: Megillat Esther: The Book of Esther
name.str_pl: copies of Megillat Esther: The Book of Esther

variants.description: A comprehensive work for celebrating Purim, this book contains the complete Book of Esther in Hebrew, multiple English translations, commentary on each of its chapters, and commentary on certain verses by a group of Conservative rabbis.  Cursed be Haman (booo)!

name.str_pl: copies of Halakhic Man

variants.description: Rabbi Joseph Soloveitchik's argument on the proper path to moral virtue through Torah scholarship and observance to the law, through the intellect and not through mystical experience or surrender to God.

name.str_pl: copies of the Maxwell House Haggadah

variants.description: Just like bubbe used to have at the Seder.  A true classic of the Jewish people despite its origin as a marketing tactic to sell coffee, the Maxwell House Haggadah has sold millions of copies and graced the Passover tables of millions of families.

name.str: Reviving Synagogue Communities Using Smart Tech
name.str_pl: copies of Reviving Synagogue Communities Using Smart Tech

variants.description: A discussion of ways to use modern technology to alleviate the administrative burden on clergy and synagogue staff but without losing the human touch that leads to a proper religious community.

name.str: On Repentance And Repair: Making Amends in an Unapologetic World
name.str_pl: copies of On Repentance And Repair: Making Amends in an Unapologetic World

variants.description: Rabbi Danya Ruttenberg's commentary on the great Jewish philosopher Maimonides ideas about "Tikkun Olam", often translated as "Repairing the World," and how while popular ideas of forgiveness often involve moving on after the apology, the Hebrew word "teshuvah" means something closer to "return."  True repentance, then, involves making restitution for error and harm and attempting to return the world to the way it was before the damage was done.

name.str: Beyond Breaking the Glass: A Spiritual Guide to Your Jewish Wedding, Revised Edition
name.str_pl: copies of Beyond Breaking the Glass: A Spiritual Guide to Your Jewish Wedding, Revised Edition

variants.description: A practical guide to throwing a Jewish wedding, including checklists, a timeline, and ways to make traditional rituals resonate with modern wedding guests.

name.str: People Love Dead Jews: Reports from a Haunted Present
name.str_pl: copies of People Love Dead Jews: Reports from a Haunted Present

variants.description: Dara Horn's exploration of the modern rise of antisemitism, why there is so much interest in Jewish tragedy and comparatively little interest in Jewish culture, and why non-Jews feature so often and so prominently in popular stories of the Holocaust.  It would probably have been riveting and insightful before the Cataclysm made such concerns mostly irrelevant.

name.str: God in Search of Man : A Philosophy of Judaism
name.str_pl: copies of God in Search of Man : A Philosophy of Judaism

variants.description: Rabbi Abraham Joshua Heschel's philosophical work on religious thought, on revelation and the problem of evil, and on the nature of a God who seeks a partner in humanity.

name.str: Not in God's Name: Confronting Religious Violence
name.str_pl: copies of Not in God's Name: Confronting Religious Violence

variants.description: Rabbi Abraham Joshua Heschel's answer to the claim that religion is fundamentally divisive and encourages conflict.  His main argument is that religiously-motivated violence stems from misreadings of sacred texts.

name.str: When Bad Things Happen to Good People
name.str_pl: copies of When Bad Things Happen to Good People

variants.description: A meditation on meaningless tragedy and why the disaster and sorrow in the world is unevenly distributed.  Written decades before the Cataclysm, but the author was obviously on to something.

name.str_pl: copies of The Jewish War: Revised Edition

variants.description: An account of the Roman conquest of Judea and the destruction of the Temple written by Josephus, the first century Judean rebel turned Roman negotiator.

name.str: Standing Again at Sinai: Judaism from a Feminist Perspective
name.str_pl: copies of Standing Again at Sinai: Judaism from a Feminist Perspective

variants.description: A critique of Jewish practice by a Jewish feminist theologian.

name.str: Zohar: The Book of Splendor: Basic Readings from the Kabbalah
name.str_pl: copies of Zohar: The Book of Splendor: Basic Readings from the Kabbalah

variants.description: A book of Jewish mysticism often attributed to the great rabbi Shimon bar Yochai, the Zohar is the central work of Kabbalah.  This is an abridged version containing selected passages from the full text.

name.str: Miriam's Tambourine: Jewish Folktales from Around the World
name.str_pl: copies of Miriam's Tambourine: Jewish Folktales from Around the World

variants.description: A collection of over fifty Jewish folktales, from classics like the story of Miriam's well or Rabbi Loew and the golem or the life of the Baal Shem Tov, to Jewish versions of modern cultural classics like Snow White or Sinbad.

name.str: From the Maccabees to the Mishnah
name.str_pl: copies of From the Maccabees to the Mishnah

variants.description: A history of the development of Rabbinic Judaism, from the Jewish Revolt in the first century to the writing of the Mishnah, and how Judaism and Christianity fully separated.

description: A ruined book.  Someone has thoroughly ruined this book by ripping pages out and covering the remainder in… is that paint?
Scraps of paper that used to be part of a book.  Completely useless now.
